solution.text:
volume of juice inside the glass = Volume of the cylinder - volume of the hemisphere
Now volume of the cylinder\(=[\pi \times r^2\times l]\), radius of the cylinder=\(_{j}_\) and \(l\)=_{{2*j}}_
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{{2*j}}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*2*j,2)}}_\)
volume of the hemisphere at the bottom of the cylinders\(=[ \frac 23 \times \pi \times r^3]\)
radius of the cylinders = radius of the hemisphere= _{j}_
volume of the hemisphere\(= [ \frac 23 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^3]= _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j*j*j/3,2)}}_\)
Now the volume of juice inside the glass\(=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*2*j,2)}}_ - _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j*j*j/3,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*2*j-2*pi_val*j*j*j/3,2)}}_\,cm^3\)
Total volume of juice sold = number of glasses \(\times \) volume of juice in a glass
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*2*j-2*pi_val*j*j*j/3,2)}}_ \times _{l}_ = _{{trunc(l*(pi_val*j*j*2*j-2*pi_val*j*j*j/3),2)}}_\,cm^3\)

content.text:
A juice vendor solds _{l}_ glasses of juice in a day.
In each glass has a raised portion in the shape of a hemisphere.
If in the given figure H denotes _{{2*j}}_ cm and D denotes _{{2*j}}_ cm then find the total volume of juice he sells in a day
